result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric T McDaniel Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--To submit DNA sample

records.addlTxt:
(SF) Case called at 9:37 am 
Defendant Eric T McDaniel in court, in custody with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

DA Happ advises that there is victim rights compliance.

Service of Amended Information; maximum penalties recited.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on amended information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.

Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence consecutive to any sentence in being -- otherwise forthwith
--4 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs, fees and surcharges due within 60 days or to setup a payment plan within 60 days; non-payment results in a 20 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.
--To pay restitution of $475 payable to Escape Teen Center joint and serveral with David Ulsberger to be converted to a civil judgment

To submit a DNA Sample.

Felony Firearm/Voting Restrictions Warnings Given
Recess:9:48 am
NEXT: Once Clerk calculates total send Time to Pay Slip to Defenadnt
AMENDED
Status conference on October 17, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 27, 2017 at 11:40 am.

Case called at 10:10am [mo]
[Scheduled for a Plea/Sentencing today]
Defendant Eric T McDaniel does NOT appear in court.
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa appears in court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Atty. De La Rosa does not have an explanation for Mr. McDaniel's non-appearance.
ADA Hall requests a warrant and bond to be found in forfeit

The Court issues a bench warrant, body only, extraditable within the United States. The Court finds bond to be in default and orders it forfeit.
recess: 10:14am

case called at 1:20pm. [mo]
Commissioner Fremgen presiding for Branch II Intake 
Defendant Eric T McDaniel appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Atty. De La Rosa indicates that Mr. McDaniel is eligible for PD representation 
Mr. McDaniel informs the Court that he is not a Junior and this should be removed from his name. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000 signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Escape Teen Center which is located at 321 Bluff St. in Fort Atkinson
--no contact with David Ulsberger
recess 1:26pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on June 3, 2015 at 9:00am   (2) Status Conference on June 30, 2015 at 9:00am
